abstract.t: Open Caching architecture is a use case of Content Delivery Networks Interconnection (CDNI) in which the commercial Content Delivery Network (CDN) is the upstream CDN (uCDN) and the ISP caching layer serves as the downstream CDN (dCDN). The document specifies extensions to the Footprint and Capabilities Interface (FCI) that are derived from requirements raised by Open Caching but are also applicable to CDNI use cases in general.
